q: Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.
h:
“Start each day with a positive thought and a grateful heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.
h:
“Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The final mystery is oneself.
h:
“The final mystery is oneself.” —
Oscar Wilde

q: Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance
h:
“Every moment of happiness requires a great amount of Ignorance” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
h:
“Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.” —
Colin Powell

q: Be brave enough to suck at something new.
h:
“Be brave enough to suck at something new.” —
Unknown

q: There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.
h:
“There are few reasons for telling the truth, but for lying the number is infinite.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.
h:
“Dance first. Think later. It's the natural order.” —
Samuel Beckett

q: Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.
h:
“Greatest success comes just one step beyond the point at which defeat overtakes you.” —
Unknown

q: Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.
h:
“Deeds will not be less valiant because they are upraised.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.
h:
“Happiness must be grown in one's own garden.” —
Mary Engelbreit

q: If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.
h:
“If you have only one smile in you give it to the people you love.” —
Maya Angelou

q: You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.
h:
“You were put on this earth to achieve your greatest self, to live out your purpose, and to do it courageously.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.
h:
“Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Life is simply what our feelings do to us.
h:
“Life is simply what our feelings do to us.” —
Honore de Balzac

q: Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.
h:
“Genius, in truth, means little more than the faculty of perceiving in an unhabitual way.” —
William James

q: We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening
h:
“We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening” —
Zhuangzi

q: You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!
h:
“You don't need anybody to tell you who you are or what you are. You are what you are!” —
John Lennon

q: Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.
h:
“Successful people appreciate where they have come from, but they don't let their past set the tone for their future.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Society is composed of two great classes those who have more dinners than appetite, and those who have more appetite than dinners.
h:
“Society is composed of two great classes those who have more dinners than appetite, and those who have more appetite than dinners.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
h:
“Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.” —
John Lennon

q: Lying can never save us from another lie.
h:
“Lying can never save us from another lie.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Learning never exhausts the mind.
h:
“Learning never exhausts the mind. ” —
Leonardo da Vinci

q: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
h:
“Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.” —
John Wooden

q: Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?
h:
“Nothing ever happened in the past that can prevent you from being present now; and if the past cannot prevent you from being present now, what power does it have?” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.
h:
“Out of your vulnerabilities will come your strength.” —
Sigmund Freud

q: The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.
h:
“The danger of an adventure is worth a thousand days of ease and comfort.” —
Paulo Coelho

q: We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences
h:
“We crave for new sensations but soon become indifferent to them. The wonders of yesterday are today common occurrences ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
h:
“When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.
h:
“Through selfless service, you will always be fruitful and find the fulfillment of your desires.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Don't think money does everything or you are going to end up doing everything for money.
h:
“Don't think money does everything or you are going to end up doing everything for money.” —
Voltaire

q: The strongest and sweetest songs yet remain to be sung.
h:
“The strongest and sweetest songs yet remain to be sung.” —
Walt Whitman

q: Success seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.
h:
“Success seems to be connected to action. Successful people keep moving. They make mistakes, but they don't quit.” —
Conrad Hilton

q: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.
h:
“Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.
h:
“Why live an ordinary life, when you can live an extraordinary one.” —
Tony Robbins

q: The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone.
h:
“The golden opportunity you are seeking is in yourself. It is not in your environment; it is not in luck or chance, or the help of others; it is in yourself alone. ” —
Orison Swett Marden

q: Spend eighty percent of your time focusing on the opportunities of tomorrow rather than the problems of yesterday.
h:
“Spend eighty percent of your time focusing on the opportunities of tomorrow rather than the problems of yesterday.” —
Brian Tracy

q: To become what you are not, behave as you do not.
h:
“To become what you are not, behave as you do not.” —
T.S. Eliot

q: Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.
h:
“Most people fail in life because they major in minor things.” —
Tony Robbins

q: Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.
h:
“Don't let the fear of losing be greater than the excitement of winning.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.
h:
“Surround yourself only with people who are going to take you higher.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: We turn not older with years but newer every day.
h:
“We turn not older with years but newer every day.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: The key to success is failure.
h:
“The key to success is failure.” —
Michael Jordan

q: If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.
h:
“If ever you feel like an animal among men, be a lion.” —
Criss Jami

q: Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.
h:
“Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Even though you are on the right track - you will get run over if you just sit there.
h:
“Even though you are on the right track - you will get run over if you just sit there.” —
Will Rogers
